intro: Leucas malayana, commonly known as the Malayan leucas, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Leucas malayana is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
